Description.val:
This funding procures long-lead major end items required for repairs to both variants of Littoral Combat Ships (LCS). The items procured mitigate major long-lead replacement times due to unplanned system failures and casualties and increases availability of vital Fleet assets by reducing repair part procurement and delivery times. Funding procures support equipment, required ancillary equipment, and associated engineering and technical support services for LCS.

LN001 - LCS Battle Spares
This line procures shore-based battle spares, ensuring their availability in the event of a failure or major casualty to key systems. Systems that require shore-based spares include gas turbines, diesel engines and generators, propulsion systems, reduction gears, auxiliary propulsion units (APUs), and machinery plant control & monitoring systems (MPCMSs). Inventory objectives are determined by the LCS Reliability, Maintainability, and Availability (RMA) Plan, NAVSEA RMA guidance, the critical application of equipment, and vendor data. 

LN002 - LCS Water Jet Spares
Both LCS variants are propelled by water jets; this line procures spare water jets and water jet components.  There are two LCS designs, the FREEDOM variant and the INDEPENDENCE variant, each using four water jets. The FREEDOM variant uses Rolls-Royce water jets and the INDEPENDENCE variant uses Wartsila Lips water jets.  The water jet assemblies are mounted externally on the ships' transom.
These items will be designated 2S cog material and support a rotable pool for life cycle sustainment. In the event of a casualty, the water jets are removed and sent to a depot to be repaired. 

LN003 - Engineering Services
This funding provides engineering and technical support for LCS Class Support Equipment.  Services include the establishment of Technical Data Packages (TDPs) and the creation of associated depot level repair parts lists/installation requirements. Funding is also provided for Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) and Design Services Allocation (DSA) modernization efforts tied to the ship availabilities.  

LN004 - Habitability Modification
In FY16, the budget funded Habitability Modifications (berthing racks and potable water) to increase permanent berthing to 98 for FREEDOM and INDEPENDENCE variants for LCS 5 thru LCS 8.  
FY17 budget funds berthing spaces, refrigeration (chill and freeze), dry provision stores, potable water, solid waste storage, and laundry.

LN005 - LCS Ships Class Safety Design Changes
Safety modifications include the redesigned stern ramp for the FREEDOM variant ships to support 11M Rigid Hull Inflatable Boats (RHIB) operations and the installation of bridge wing for safe and effective operation on the INDEPENDENCE variant ships.
In FY18, the budget for the LCS Ships Class Safety Design Changes was realigned to LI 1604, LCS In-Service Modernization.

LN006 - LCS Ships Class Ancillary Equipment
This funding procures the connective equipment necessary to ensure fit and function of procured LCS Class Support Equipment when installed.

LN007 - AFSB SOF MODs
This funding procures the 3-D Air Search Radar to modify the Mobile Landing Platform-Afloat Forward Staging Base (MLP-AFSB) (Expeditionary Mobile Base, ESB) to support Special Operations Forces (SOF) requirements.

Justification.val:
LN001 - LCS Battle Spares
This line procures shore-based battle spares to ensure their availability in the event of a failure or major casualty to key systems. FY18 procure 2 MT-30 Gas Turbine Engine procurement (Inclusive of all sub assemblies), as opposed to the procurement of individual/fully-usable sub-assemblies (stages) in previous years.  Additionally Radars for both Variants are being procured along with Main Propulsion Diesel Engines (MPDE) for both variants.

LN002 - LCS Water Jet Spares
LCS water jets procurements in the event of a casualty, none procured in FY18.

LN003 - Engineering Services
This funding provides engineering and technical support for LCS Class Support Equipment develops Technical Data Packages (TDPs) and creates associated depot level repair parts lists/installation requirements.

LN004 - Habitability Modification
Habitability Modifications (racks, increased provisioning stowage, solid waste stowage, laundry capacity and potable water) to increase permanent berthing to 98 for FREEDOM and INDEPENDENCE variants.

LN005 - LCS Ships Class Safety Design Changes
Safety modifications include the redesigned stern ramp for the FREEDOM variant ships to support 11M Rigid Hull Inflatable Boats (RHIB) operations and the installation of bridge wing for safe and effective operation on the INDEPENDENCE variant ships.

LN006 - LCS Ships Class Ancillary Equipment
This funding procures the connective equipment necessary to ensure fit and function of procured Class Support Equipment when installed.

LN007 - AFSB SOF MODs
This funding procures the 3-D Air Search Radar to modify the Mobile Landing Platform-Afloat Forward Staging Base (MLP-AFSB) (Expeditionary Mobile Base, ESB) to support Special Operations Forces (SOF) requirements.
